intro: Rechsteineria canescens, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, grayish foliage. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Rechsteineria canescens is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators.
